titleStmt.title: Gallant newes from the seas. Being a relation of certaine speeches made by Prince Charles, the Duke of Yorke, the Lord Montrosse, sea-men and land-men, with their resolutions: / gathered together by a sea-man lately come from sea, and framed into a song by him; whose name is Tom Smith. To the tune of, The fleat at sea,.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Rouse up your spirits and make haste away ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
